nodes.text: A seallia sandwich was a toasted sandwich dish which could be served for breakfast. The Devaronian chef Sama Macoy served a double-toasted seallia sandwich with a heavy and sweet blood syrup as her entry into the first round of a cooking competition meant to determine the next sous-chef of the castle of the pirate Maz Kanata on the planet Takodana. The Artiodac Strono Tuggs who worked as head chef at the castle considered the sandwich his favourite entry in the first round, which had tasked the contestants with creating a breakfast platter.

Seallia sandwich first appeared in the short story "A Recipe for Death", which was written by Landry Q. Walker and published in the Tales from a Galaxy Far, Far Away: Aliens: Volume I anthology book on April 5, 2016.
